ChartEMAIndicator.Description:
You have the option to chart up to 3 Exponential Moving Averages (EMAs) at the same time. The 3 input boxes above represent the periods of the Exponential Moving Averages you wish to chart
If you are charting on minute, daily or weekly periods, the EMA periods you indicate above will be for minutes, days and weeks, respectively. An EMA differs slightly from a Simple Moving Average (SMA) in that it gives extra weight to more recent price data. This allows investors to track and respond quickly to recent price trends that might take more time to appear in an SMA. The formula for an EMA is: EMA = price today * K + EMA yest * (1-K) where K = 2 / (N+1). Like an SMA, it smooths out a data series, making it easier to spot trends.

ChartBBandsIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the period and number of standard deviations used to calculate the Bollinger Bands above. The default period and deviations are set to 20 and 2, respectively.
Bollinger Bands are a type of envelope plotted at standard deviation levels above and below a simple moving average. Since standard deviation is a measure of volatility, the bands are self-adjusting -- widening during volatile markets and contracting during calmer periods.
"The basic interpretation of Bollinger Bands is that prices tend to stay within the upper and lower band. The spacing between the bands varies based on the volatility of the prices. During periods of extreme price changes (i.e. high volatility), the bands widen to become more forgiving. During periods of stagnant pricing (i.e. low volatility), the bands narrow to contain prices.
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartFastStochastric.Description:
You have the option to change the %K and %D periods of the Fast Stochastic above. The default %K and %D periods are set to 5 and 3, respectively.
The Fast Stochastic compares where a security's price closed relative to its price range over a given time period, and is displayed as two lines. One line is called %K. A second line, called %D, is a moving average of %K.
  • Buy when the Oscillator (either %K or %D) falls below a specific level (e.g. 20) and then rises above that level. Sell when the Oscillator rises above a specific level (e.g. 80) and then falls below that level.
  • Buy when the %K line rises above the %D line and sell when the %K line falls below the %D line.
  • Look for divergences. For example, where prices are making a series of new highs and the Slow Stochastic Oscillator is failing to surpass its previous highs.
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartMACDIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the slow, fast and signal periods used to calculate the MACD above. The default slow, fast and signal periods are set to 26, 12 and 9, respectively. Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) is a trend-following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two moving averages of prices. The default MACD is represented as the difference between a 26-day and 12-day EMA of the price. A 9-day EMA of the MACD, referred to as the signal (or trigger) line, is plotted on top of the MACD to indicate buy/sell opportunities. Divergence, the difference between the MACD and the signal, is also plotted as a histogram.
The MACD is most effective in wide-swinging trading markets. There are three standard ways to interprete the MACD:
• Crossovers
The basic MACD trading rule is to sell when the MACD falls below its signal line. Similarly, a buy signal occurs when the MACD rises above its signal line. It's also popular to buy/sell when the MACD goes above/below zero.
• Overbought/Oversold Conditions
The MACD is also useful as an overbought/oversold indicator. When the shorter moving average pulls away dramatically from the longer moving average (i.e. the MACD rises), it's likely that the security price is overextending and will soon return to more realistic levels. MACD overbought and oversold conditions exist vary from security to security.
• Divergences
An indication that an end to the current trend may be near occurs when the MACD diverges from the security. A bearish divergence occurs when the MACD is making new lows while prices fail to reach new lows. A bullish divergence occurs when the MACD is making new highs while prices fail to reach new highs. Both of these divergences are most significant when they occur at relatively overbought/oversold levels.
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartMFIIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the period of the Money Flow Index (MFI) above. The default period is set to 14. Measuring the strength of money flowing in and out of a security, the Money Flow Index (MFI) is a momentum indicator similar in function to the Relative Strength Index (RSI). The primary difference being that while the RSI only incorporates prices, the MFI accounts for volume.
"Look for divergence between the MFI and the price action. If the price trends higher and the MFI trends lower (or vice versa), a reversal may be imminent. Look for market tops to occur when the MFI is above 80. Look for market bottoms to occur when the MFI is below 20."
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartWilliamsRIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the period of the Williams %R above. The default period is set to 14. The Williams %R indicator seeks to measure overbought/oversold levels.
"Readings in the range of 80 to 100% indicate that the security is oversold while readings in the 0 to 20% range suggest that it is overbought."
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartSMAIndicator.Description:
You have the option to chart up to 3 Simple Moving Averages (SMAs) at the same time. The 3 input boxes above represent the periods of the Simple Moving Averages you wish to chart.
If you are charting on minute, daily or weekly periods, the SMA periods you indicate above will be for minutes, days and weeks, respectively. An SMA is calculated by adding the security's prices for the most recent N time periods and then dividing by N. It smooths out a data series, making it easier to spot trends.

ChartPSARIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the step period and max step period used to calculate the Parabolic SAR above. The default step and max periods are set to 0.02 and 0.20, respectively.
Also known as the "Parabolic Time/Price System," this indicator is used to set trailing price stops and is usually referred to as the "SAR" (stop-and-reversal).
"The Parabolic SAR provides excellent exit points. You should close long positions when the price falls below the SAR and close short positions when the price rises above the SAR. If you are long (i.e. the price is above the SAR), the SAR will move up every day, regardless of the direction the price is moving. The amount the SAR moves up depends on the amount that prices move."
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartROCIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the period of the Rate of Change (ROC) above. The default period is set to 12. The Rate of Change (ROC) indicator displays the difference between the current price and the price x-time periods ago. The difference can be displayed in either points or as a percentage.
"The 12-day ROC is an excellent short to intermediate term overbought/oversold indicator. The higher the ROC, the more overbought the security; the lower the ROC, the more likely a rally. However, as with all overbought/over-sold indicators, it is prudent to wait for the market to begin to correct (i.e. turn up or down) before placing your trade. A market that appears overbought may remain overbought for some time. In fact, extremely overbought/oversold readings usually imply a continuation of the current trend. The 12-day ROC tends to be very cyclical, oscillating back and forth in a fairly regular cycle. Often, price changes can be anticipated by studying the previous cycles of the ROC and relating the previous cycles to the current market."
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartRSIIndicator.Description:
You have the option to change the period of the Relative Strength Index (RSI) above. The default period is set to 14. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) measures the price of a security against its past performance in order to determine its internal strength (in an attempt to quantify the security's price momentum).
"A popular method of analyzing the RSI is to look for a divergence in which the security is making a new high, but the RSI is failing to surpass its previous high. This divergence is an indication of an impending reversal. When the RSI then turns down and falls below its most recent trough, it is said to have completed a 'failure swing.' The failure swing is considered a confirmation of the impending reversal."
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartSlowStochast.Description:
You have the option to change the %K and %D periods of the Slow Stochastic above. The default %K and %D periods are set to 15 and 5, respectively.
The MACD is most effective in wide-swinging trading markets. There are three popular ways to interpret the Slow Stochastic:
  • Buy when the Oscillator (either %K or %D) falls below a specific level (e.g. 20) and then rises above that level. Sell when the Oscillator rises above a specific level (e.g. 80) and then falls below that level.
  • Buy when the %K line rises above the %D line and sell when the %K line falls below the %D line.
  • Look for divergences. For example, where prices are making a series of new highs and the Slow Stochastic Oscillator is failing to surpass its previous highs.
- "Technical Analysis from A to Z" by Stephen Aechlis

ChartVolumeIndicator.Description:
Volume is the number of shares traded in a security during a given period of time. Volume is plotted automatically as part of the default chart settings.
Volume is an important indicator in technical analysis as it is used to measure the worth of a market move. If the markets have made strong price move either up or down, the perceived strength of that move depends on the volume for that period. The higher the volume during that price move, the more significant the move.

ChartVolumeMAIndicator.Description: You have the option to change the period of the Volume + MA above. The default period is set to 13. The Volume + MA represents the number of shares transacted every day. In addition, a 13-day volume Exponential Moving Average (EMA) overlay is used to provide additional information on the volume trend

Logon.IDGMsg: VTOSカードに記載のある数字をご入力下さい
Logon.AdvMsg1:
VNダイレクトのオンライン取引サービスご案内
・　オンラインでのご注文
・　ポートフォリオマネジメント
・　約定結果報告
・　取引履歴閲覧

取引案内   |   免責事項
Logon.AdvMsg2:
VNダイレクトでオンライン取引口座を開設します。
　　　口座をお持ちの方は次のサービスがご利用になれます。
　　　　　　　　　　　　・　電話でのご注文
　　　　　　　　　　　　・　オンラインでのご注文
　　　　　　　　　　　　・　携帯メッセージでの約定結果報告
　　　　　　　　　　　　・　ポートフォリオのオンライン管理
Logon.SecurityInfo: セキュリティに関するご注意：お客様が一般的なパソコンをご利用されている場合、パソコンから離れる前にVNダイレクトオンライン取引プログラムからログアウトし、ブラウザーが閉じられたことを確認して下さい。また、VNダイレクト証券からお客様のユーザーネーム、パスワード、その他の個人情報についておたずねすることは決してありません。ご不明な点がございましたら、こちらのメールアドレスまでお問い合せ下さい：otoiawase@vndirect.com.vn
Logon.SecurityInfoIDG:
注意：

- VTOSカードのシリアル番号が入力したシリアル番号と同一かどうか確認下さい。
- 認証番号は正確に入力してください。
- 認証番号にあるアルファベットは大文字でも小文字でも構いません。
- 認証番号の入力を3回間違えると、VTOSカードがロックされます。。
- VTOSカードに関するお問い合わせは、otoiawase@vndirect.com.vnまでご連絡ください。
Logon.Confirm_Message: オンラインメンバーへの登録に成功しました。口座をアクティブするため、添付資料に記載されているユーザーネームとパスワードを入力してください。

ChooseAccount.InstructionOpenAccount: Instruction to open an account at VNDirect

Home.CreateAnAccount:
How do you know about VNDirect online? From newspapers, magazines and television From internet From friends Introducer code 第1ステップ：お客様はベトナム人投資家ですか、それとも外国人投資家ですか? ベトナム人投資家です(ベトナム人であり、人民証明書を持っています)。 外国人投資家 ベトナム法律に基づく外国人投資家の定義： ・　海外法律、外国人(居住又は非居住)又は海外に住んでいるベトナム人にて設立された機関。 ・　分割される利益或いはベトナムで儲ける合法的な収入で証券を売買する、外資企業の海外パートナー(個人若しくは法人)。 第1ステップ：お客様はベトナムで他の証券会社で口座を開設したことがありますか？ はい いいえ 第1ステップ：VNダイレクトで開設したい口座を選択して下さい。 VNダイレクトでオンライン取引口座を開設するのは簡単です。わずか1分程度しかかかりません。 お客様に最も相応しい口座を選択して下さい。 個人口座　：　この口座を所有するのは唯一お客様だけの場合。 共同口座　：　他のもう一名様と共同で口座を開設される場合。 法人口座　：　お客様の会社のために口座開設される場合。 投資グループ口座　：　共同で投資されるグループのために口座開設される場合。 委任　：　別の方に委任される口座開設される場合。 s 第1段階：VNダイレクトで開設したい口座を選択して下さい ; VNダイレクトで取引口座を追加開設したいですか？ 投資チャンスを待っている間、投資口座を通してVNDダイレクトへご自分の遊休資本の管理を委託されますと、投資口座の資金は国家証券委員会のポートフォリオマネジメントについての規定に従って運用されます。 取り決め事項(誓約書) 証券価格は常に変動し、上昇下落を繰り返します。時には購入された証券が全く価値のないものになってしまうこともあります。こうした証券取引の潜在的なリスク、時には損失が生じるということをご了承ください。また証券取引における第三者への委任は、お客様の元契約と不可分のものではなく、取引委任によって生じるいかなる責任もお客様のものとなります。VNダイレクト証券が提供するオンライン取引のご利用に当たっては、通信量過多、市場変動、システムメンテナンス及びアップグレード、及びその他の理由で、インターネット接続や電子機器のご利用が制限される場合があることをご了承ください。不測の事態、或いはVNダイレクト内の管理管轄以外でも、インターネット回線の閉鎖や通信速度の遅滞が発生する場合もございます。更に、第三者によって個人データ及び情報が不正に取得される場合もあります。こうしたオンライン取引におけるあらゆるリスクをご了承ください。ご契約書にご署名頂いた場合、誓約書の内容について、VNダイレクト証券がお客様に十分にご説明させて頂いたことをご了承頂いたものと見なされます。　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　 お客様に対するVNダイレクトの全ての条項をご理解頂けた場合には、”同意する”を選択してください。 納税コード 同意しない もう一度情報をご確認してください。 このページを印刷する オンライン取引口座開設 口座番号 口座種類 フルネーム 誕生日 性別 身分証明書類 身分証明書類/パスポート番号 発行日 発行場所 口座控え受取時期 取引確認と口座控えの受取方法 私は口座開設申請書の情報が全て事実であり、関連事項に変更があればVNダイレクト証券へ直ぐに報告することを誓います。 I understand that this application will not be effective until it is received, verified and accepted by VNDS Company.
Signature
Signature(s) of Applicant(s):
Name
Date 会社情報 法定名 国際取引名称 略称 営業許可番号 口座状態 口座種類 口座登録日 オンライン口座検索 発行日 本社 都道府県 国 電話番号 Fax 会社形態 経営分野 納税コード 営業許可書を持っている国内法人はオンライン取引口座を開設することができます。海外企業の場合は、ここ　をクリックして、ベトナムでの証券取引口座開設の手順をご理解ください。 CreateIndividualAccount.AccountInfo: Thông tin về chủ tài khoản
CreateIndividualAccount.TipGuide: TIP: Những mục có dấu (*) là mục bắt buộc phải điền.
CreateIndividualAccount.Step1_Title_2_2: Bước 1: Thông tin về chủ tài khoản (2/2)
CreateIndividualAccount.PublicManageCompany: Tên công ty đại chúng mà quý khách nắm chức danh quản lý
CreateIndividualAccount.PublicCompanyHolding: Tên công ty đại chúng mà quý khách sở hữu từ 5% vốn điều lệ trở lên
CreateIndividualAccount.AccountTip: TIP: Chúng tôi không chấp nhận ngân hàng nước ngoài.
CreateIndividualAccount.IsDelegateAccount: Có phải là tài khoản ủy thác quản lý hay không?
CreateIndividualAccount.OrderResultMethod: Phương thức nhận kết quả khớp lệnh
CreateIndividualAccount.CallToVnDirect: Khách hàng gọi điện đến VNDirect
CreateIndividualAccount.Step3_Tip: TIP: Những thông tin trên đây không mang tính bắt buộc mà chỉ để chúng tôi tham khảo nhằm mục đích phục vị quý khách tốt hơn.
CreateIndividualAccount.Step3_Note: Lưu ý: Quý khách cần đề nghị người được ủy quyền phải có giấy xác nhận của cơ quan nơi họ làm việc hoặc cơ quan có thẩm quyền tại địa phương.
CreateIndividualAccount.IsDelegateTraiding: Quý khách có đăng ký ủy quyền giao dịch hay ko?
CreateIndividualAccount.Step3_Title_1: Thông tin người được ủy quyền
CreateIndividualAccount.Step3_Tip: TIP: Khi in phiếu mở tài khoản, phần ủy quyền quý khách vui lòng ký xác nhận vào "Phạm vi ủy quyền" và "Thời gian ủy quyền" nếu quý khách có đăng ký ủy quyền giao dịch.
CreateIndividualAccount.Step4_RemoteTraiding: Bước 3: Đăng ký giao dịch từ xa
CreateIndividualAccount.Step4_OnlineTraiding: Đăng ký giao dịch trực tuyến
CreateIndividualAccount.OnlineTraidingBy: Giao dịch trực tuyến được thực hiện bởi
CreateIndividualAccount.TraidingByPhone: Đăng ký giao dịch qua điện thoại
CreateIndividualAccount.TelTraidingBy: Giao dịch điện thoại được thực hiện bởi
CreateIndividualAccount.FromRegisterPhone: Từ các số điện thoại ở bước 2
CreateIndividualAccount.FromAnyPhone: Từ một số điện thoại bất kỳ
CreateIndividualAccount.PasswordRule: Lưu ý: Yêu cầu nhập 4 chữ số
CreateIndividualAccount.AgreementNote:
• Bằng việc kí vào phiếu này, tôi cam kết tuân thủ các quy định về giao dịch qua điện thoại và trực tuyến được cung cấp bởi Công ty Cổ phần Chứng khoán VNDirect ("Công ty") và sử dụng các thông tin nhận dạng đã được đăng kí ở trên.
  • Tôi đồng ý rằng bất kỳ giao dịch trực tuyến và/hoặc qua điện thoại nào với Công ty sử dụng các thông tin nhận dạng đã đăng kí ở trên đều được hiểu là giao dịch do tôi thực hiện.
  • Tôi cam kết chịu trách nhiệm bảo mật các thông tin nhận dạng đã đăng kí ở trên và các thông tin nhận dạng liên quan khác và sẽ hoàn toàn chịu trách nhiệm trong trường hợp thông tin nhận dạng bị tiết lộ.
CreateIndividualAccount.ObjectiveCapacity: Bước 4: Mục tiêu và năng lực đầu tư
CreateIndividualAccount.RiskInvestment: Mức độ chấp nhận rủi ro
CreateIndividualAccount.Step5_Tip: TIP: Những thông tin trên đây không mang tính bắt buộc mà chỉ để chúng tôi tham khảo nhằm mục đích phục vị quý khách tốt hơn.

RegisterUser.Dashboard_Lable:
INVESTING & TRADING WITH VNDIRECT ONLINE

Fast and Secure Solution Get the VNDirect Online advantage.

Monitor your stocks in real-time using VNDirect FREE streaming Quotes, Charts and News. Other valuable tools include My Porfolios Integrated Account Management to help you track individual stocks and make timely trades.

Portfolios.WarnMsg: 投資ポートフォリオ及び名簿は正式な目的での使用は出来ません(例：税務署への申告)。あくまでお客様ご自身の財務管理のサポートとしてご利用ください。お客様の証券に関して十分で正確な情報を入手するためには、口座控え及び/或いは取引確認をご利用ください。 VNダイレクト証券から提供された情報・データを受け取り、ご利用される際には、お客様は、VNダイレクト証券が、1)提供情報・データの著作権を全て持っていること、2)情報・データの保障をするものではないこと、3)この情報・データの間違えによる損失、またはVNダイレクトの管理外の原因による損失に対して、いかなる責任も負わないことに同意されたとみなされます。

Lables.ConfirmMsg: 注文が間違っていないかもう一度ご確認ください
Lables.CompletedMsg: お客様の注文はシステムに入力されました
Lables.CanceledMsg: Your order has been placed succesful and processing.
Lables.NoticeMsg: 注意事項：注文の確認をしています。注文の重複を避けるために、クリックは一度だけにしてください。
Lables.ImportantMsg:
注意事項：
価格制限にご注意ください、1,000ドン単位での入力となります。例：指数を4万5,600ドンとしたい場合には、45.6と入力してください。また150,000ドンとしたい場合には、150と入力してください。
Lables.OutOffTradingMsg: ご注文を承った時点では、取引は終了しております。お客様のご注文はシステムに入力され、受付時間順に優先順位がつけられます。取引が開始された時点で、取引を行います。取引開始後、お客様のご注文が受理されたことをご確認ください。
Lables.MarketClosedMsg:
取引注文受付時間が終了いたしました。
下記の時間に改めてご注文いただきますようお願いいたします。
■ホーチミン証券取引所：
　取引日の前日の午後10時～取引当日午前10時30分
　（日本時間午前0時～午後12時30分）
■ハノイ証券取引所：
　取引日の前日の午後10時～午前11時
　　（日本時間午前0時～午後1時）

StockWizard.Stock_Research_Wizard:
Stock Research Wizard

Using a guided approach, VNDirect Stock Research Wizard makes I easy to research stocks.

How it works:

  • Enter a stock symbol and click Go.
  • Step through each page and any additional links and functions provided.
  • On the final page, compare your chosen stock to any other stock.

Stock Research Wizard helps investor look at five vital issues:

company announcements and news

StockWizard.fil_with_the_SEC_DES: Companies must disclose all material facts about their businesses to federal regulators every 3 months. Read about insider trades and restricted stock sales , institutional ownership changes, special events and other important shareholder issues.

StockWizard.Recent_purchase_and_sell_DES: Many investors believe that corporate insiders are the savviest buyers of their own stock. Insiders can be very early buyers of their stocks at rock-bottom prices.
